[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Headlines/Natha.png[/img][/align]

[color=#FFFFE0][b]New Rule: Pornographic Anime[/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has officially released a new rule in the [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=112][b][color=#FFFFE0]Anime Aventure's[/color][/b][/url] subforum due to there being confusion around where the line is drawn. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] states any pornographic anime posted will result in an instant closure of your account. "Consider yourselves notified and warned". This stickied rule can be found [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5352329][b]here[/b][/url].

[color=#FFFFE0][b]HackForums Prestige Formula Finally Cracked[/b][/color]
The users [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2758907][b]Steve[/b][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#00AAFF][b]Xerotic[/b][/color][/url] have finally cracked the prestige formula which has been unsolved for a number of years, both [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2758907][b]Steve[/b][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#00AAFF][b]Xerotic[/b][/color][/url] have created a thread explaining the formula in great detail. The thread includes how many posts, reputation, time online, and other factors which play a part in your prestige points. It's a great read, and you can find this thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5349368][b]here[/b][/url].

[color=#FFFFE0][b]Pokemon Go Bonanza[/b][/color]
After only a few weeks of the release of the subforum Pokemon Go, the subforum has already reached a total of 1,800 threads and 43,000 posts. A lot of this activity is from multiple members trying their luck to get the [url=http://hackforums.net/myawards.php?awid=93][b]Poké Ball[/b][/url] award which is given out randomly by being active in the section. The [url=http://hackforums.net/myawards.php?awid=93][b]Poké Ball[/b][/url] award has a current chance of 1 in 250.

[color=#FFFFE0][b]Omniscient's Inactivity[/b][/color]
A lot of members have recently been talking about the inactivity of [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] over the past few days relating to sticky purchases, upgrades, and awards. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] profile was marked with an away status which stated he was unwell and recovering from a flu. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] seems to be slightly more active today sticking threads, and making a new rule. We hope you get well soon, Omni.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5347622][b]I'm BV1, Ex Blackshades Admin + Current Convicted Felon - Lets Discuss the Past[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3183372][color=#00AAFF][b]Previously Known As....[/b][/color][/url]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5351040][b]HACK FORUMS SONG [Work In Progress] - GET YOUR NAME MENTIONED![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3210805][color=#EFEFEF][b]Soonami[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Interested in having your name in a "Hack Forums song"? Register your name here to be included!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5351366][b]Summit1G At Gunpoint Playing Pokemon Go[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3042348][color=#EFEFEF][b]NodNod[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Thread has been made showing popular Twitch streamer, Summit1G being swatted in a park while playing Pokemon Go.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/301.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269]Conor McGregor[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Hello and welcome to the Hack Forums News!
Before we start are there any shout outs you would like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: Shoutout to my boy Lyndon (NulldB)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Alright, sounds good.  Lets get started shall we.
So I suppose the obvious question to start with is, what brought you to Hack Forums and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: I was recommended HF by a close friend back in early 2015 who is now closed unfortunately. I didn't decide to register until around the mid of 2015 (Just over a year now). I came to originally monetize but now I've stayed simply because of the community and the odd exchange or sale.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: In which way did you plan on Monetizing originally?  I noticed heavy activity on your part in the Currency Exchange section.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: To be honest if I recall correctly I came to originally sell CS:GO skins as I was told there was a massive market for them onsite. I was in the betting & steam stealing game back then and thought I'd give it a go. I then moved off to buying all the BTC I could as I like stocking up on it. Although I buy a lot of BTC I also sell BTC for a little profit of course.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: This is true, the CSGO Skins were a major thing for quite some time.  Naturally though all good things come to a slow or end.  So moving on to currency exchanging was the next logical step for you?
In that regard, Hack Forums has likely the most robust Hacker Marketplaces on the clear web, allowing for numerous opportunities for technically skilled individuals and new members alike.  Where do you see yourself taking your profiteering after Currency exchanging, if you have thought about that at all?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: Honestly exchanging currency wasn't planned. Back then I always had spare cash (paypal) and wanted to stock up on BTC. When I stocked up on a good bit I could always find people looking to buy more at a higher percentage. I would always find people that would want to buy at 13-15% +preev which is all profit. Of course my aim would be to get rid of the BTC quick as prices vary robustly when it comes to such a currency. For example, today when I woke up it was sitting at around $680 if I'm correct and now it's $647 per 1BTC. I honestly do not have any plans for the near future as to how I'm going to profit onsite as I don't really need the cash unless it's worth my time. It's more of something to do and pass time. :)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: So while doing your exchanges and messing around this is just something to do while you spend time within the community.
What other areas of the forum would you say you are drawn to and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: To be honest I'm not really drawn to any other section of HF. I sort of go with the flow, update "View New Posts" every so often to see what's happening online. I love using the PM system and contacting members and making new friends. The lounge would probably be my second most posted in sub-forum.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: The New post feature is one of my favorites as well, it takes me wandering in to forums I normally never would go.  The Lounge is in fact your most posted to forum 3x more than currency exchange, btw.  I tend to stay out of the lounge as much as possible, but I have to admit some of the most interesting threads get posted.  What would you say are your most memorable Lounge moments while on site?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: Well the post is now deleted (I decided to delete it due to my mates privacy) I ended up posting a thread to do with a video I had up and actually went viral on Worldstar, basically there was a massive brawl and I ended up getting my hands on the video that myself and a few friends were in it. There was different views from all members on HF and the post itself blew up. I posted and went to sleep and when I woke up there was like 80+ replies and by then the Worldstar video was on fire too. It was so long ago I can barely remember much but I'm pretty sure this is one of the most memorable Lounge moments.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: That's always a fun experience.  So outside of Hack Forums, what are your interests?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: Outside of HF I try to focus on boxing. I usually train 3/5 nights a week in the club and most mornings when I wake up I'd go for a reasonably long jog. I'm a previous Irish Champion and love boxing so much. If I'm not boxing then I will be working and if I'm not working then I'll be browsing the internet and whatnot. Just under a week ago I had to give away my beautiful husky named Rasta. He was my life, I honestly really did love him. I dedicated everything I could to him and he was the most loyal & loving pet I could have ever asked for. The reason I had to get rid of him was because I live in the country and here in Ireland all over the country in livestock. Rasta being a husky he somehow got out during the night and ripped apart a few sheep. I was hit with a huge bill and the option to either rehome my beloved dog or for him to be shot by the scumbag farmer. Don't get me wrong, I'm a fair guy and I realize that the farmer has lost some money (which I've repayed) but now I'm left with a massive hole in my heart. I'm also training as a electrician and have plans to move to Australia when I finish what I'm doing. I basically juggle all of this on top of my social life and it seems to be going okay at the minute.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: So your Irish and a boxer, so that means what you hit the pub 3-5 times a week then I guess? (I joke).
Physical sports are always great for endurance and training.  It sounds like you lead a busy and productive life.  What plans beyond Electrician schooling do you have if any?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: Hahaha, close enough. Not really a pub sort of guy. More of a clubbing, get shitfaced lad. I'm not going to sit here and make shit up. To be honest the only other plans I have for my future is to get to sunny Australia and meet some sexy Aussie chick since the quality of chicks here is horrible and start some sort of electrician business. I believe the stuff I do online (not just on HF) will educate me and it will give me more experience for when I do decide to go big with something in the real world. For some reason I've always found interest in music, whether it be Rap, Reggae, Techno, Trance or anything else I'd love it. Maybe one day I'll start dj'ing as some sort of side job. I don't see the point in working or specializing in a specific job unless you enjoy it or the pay is insanely good.
I'm more of a take every day as it comes type of person if you haven't already noticed that.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Well fair enough, I always thought Swedish or Norwegian chicks were the bomb, but what can I say personally.  Taking it relaxed is the way to go, don't sweat the small stuff, and its all small stuff.  We’re running out of time here, but before we go I do have one final question.   If you could play admin for a day and make a change to the site, what would it be and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2761269][color=white][b]Conor McGregor[/b][/color][/url]: Hmm. This is a good one. Honestly, I'd change the site up so make it look more modern, I remember when I first came to HF I thought it looked outdated and whatnot but now that I've been here for so long I have sort of got the hang of it now. Although I have seen photos of HF back in the day when it looked a lot older. All user bars had the same theme and everything. After changing that I would probably assign the most trusted and dedicated members that are willing to become analyzers for all scam reports which will mean hopefully scams will come to an end as it was a problem back in 2015 when I joined and by the looks of things shit has just been getting worse. I would then probably introduce some more reward systems on HF (not that it's needed) just to motivate the members that are interested to receive some type of reward. A credit system or something where you can buy stuff onsite with the credits rewarded. I would also look into some of the rules that disallow some sales on HF and maybe look over them again and make sure they're actually necessary because in my opinion some of the rules just don't make sense. Things like Steam Gifts aren't allowed to be sold. I know steam gifts can easily be obtained illegitimately but there are also legit sellers out there. Sometimes it just doesn't make sense since stolen accounts are allowed to be sold (NFA Section) but those aren't. That's just a few things. I could probably write for days ahaha but I'll stop while I can. Thanks for your precious time and having me on [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=white][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Well thank you for taking the time.

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/ScienceNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-07/osu-waw072016.php][b][color=white]America Wastes Too Much Food[/color][/b][/url]
Wasting food in America is no new trend, and a new study produced by Ohio State Universty seeks to help bring awareness to the issue. Out of the 500 people representing the U.S. population, only a little over half were aware that wasting food was a problem. For a long time, wives tales about food storage and production has lead a massive amount of waste; doctoral student Danyi Qi, who co-authored the study states, "First, we can do things to chip away at the perceived benefits of wasting food. Our study shows that many people feel they derive some type of benefit by throwing food away, but many of those benefits are not real."

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-07/nsfc-nhl072116.php][b][color=white]Looking Into the Essence of Existence[/color][/b][/url]
For decades, mankind has made its attempt at looking into the far beyond and we continue to do so today; but, unlike in the days of Einstein, our telescopes are far more powerful that anyone could have ever imagined. The beloved series [i]Star Trek[/i], which brought curiosity and the attention of the public to space exploration, is coming upon its 50th anniversary; because of that, Hubble has released another of its well-known deep field images that tell the tale of our universe. With this new image released comes clarity like we've never seen before; in fact, Hubble's released image is so clear because it uses a trick predicted by Einstein's general theory of relativity known as gravitational lensing. Hubble does this by aiming its telescope into a cluster of galaxies with so much mass that it warps the very fabric of space, and because of that, light bends around the cluster of galaxies allowing us to take full advantage of it. 

[url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/07/160722092937.htm][b][color=white]With Higher Amounts of Pain Comes a Higher Chance for Addiction[/color][/b][/url]
Since their rise in popularity, the general public has been wary of opiate-based painkillers. While extremely effective when it comes to dealing with pain, these opiate-based painkillers are also famous for their addictive attributes that have been the beginning for many lifelong opiate addictions. The Columbia University Medical Center has released a study that links a higher degree of pain that a patient is experiencing with a higher chance for opiate-based addiction. Analyzing up to 34,000 adults from a national survey of alcohol and substance abuse, the team was able to link pain (measured in a five-point scale) to recent substance abuse.

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/TechNews/Angel.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=https://blog.twitter.com/2016/announcing-an-application-process-for-verified-accounts-0][b]Twitter Now Lets Anyone Request a Blue Badge[/b][/url][/color]
Twitter announced it has created an online application process for Twitter that allows any account to possibly receive verified status. Verified accounts on Twitter allow people to identify key individuals and organizations on Twitter as authentic, and are denoted by a blue badge icon. An account may be verified if it is determined to be of public interest, Twitter noted. Examples include accounts maintained by public figures and organizations in music, TV, film, fashion, government, politics, religion, journalism, media, sports, business, and other key areas of interest.

[color=white][url=https://techcrunch.com/2016/07/22/apple-says-pokemon-go-is-the-most-downloaded-app-in-its-first-week-ever/][b]Pokémon Go Breaks iTunes Record For Downloads in the First Week[/b][/url][/color]
In news that should come as a surprise to no one, Pokemon Go has broken the record for most App Store downloads in the first week of availability. Without releasing official download numbers or stats, Apple has officially confirmed that Pokémon Go has broken the record for the highest number of downloads during launch week, ever. The mobile app from Niantic and The Pokémon Company initially launched in Australia then the United States at the start of the month while instantly hitting #1 on the App Store Top Charts. Launches across Europe including Germany, the UK, and at least 26 other countries have since followed with Japan being the most recent addition as of yesterday.

[color=white][url=http://money.cnn.com/2016/07/21/technology/kickass-torrent/][b]Kickass Torrents Seized by the US Government[/b][/url][/color]
Artem Vaulin, the alleged Ukrainian owner of file-sharing website KickassTorrents (KAT), has been arrested by Polish police on U.S. charges of criminal copyright infringement and conspiracy to commit money laundering, prosecutors say. A court in Chicago has also ordered the seizure of bank accounts and domain names related to the site. Vaulin has been formally charged with conspiracy to commit criminal copyright infringement and conspiracy to commit money laundering. As of the moment, the main KickassTorrents site appears to be down worldwide.
[/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/biggest-news-from-comic-con-2016/1100-6442016/][color=white]San Diego Comic Con's Biggest News![/color][/url][/b]
San Diego Comic Con wrapped up and I'm coming at you with the biggest highlights of the event! Capcom had some news to share regarding their recently released game, Street Fighter 5. She was previously available to play during story mode, but now Juri is officially joining the game as a playable character in every mode available. Her release will be accompanied by more premium summer costumes. A DLC package including the aforementioned content as well as a new stage and color options will be released on July 26 and will be available for $25 with a portion of the proceeds going toward the Capcom Cup. Gears of War director, Rod Fergusson, and other members of developer The Coalition were asked about the possibility of a GoW movie at their panel and hinted that one was already in production! In response to the question, he stated "There is some stuff going on that I can't talk about today, but I'll possibly be talking about [that stuff] very soon. I'm very excited about what the future holds". It is likely that we will be hearing something in the near future regarding the project that he hinted at. Ed Boon promised on Twitter that he'd reveal 2 new characters for Injustice 2 and he kept his word. He released a trailer that showcased Wonder Woman and the Blue Beetle. These two join the characters we already knew about: Batman, Superman, Supergirl, Aquaman, Atrocitus, Supergirl, and Gorilla Grodd.

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Trends.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/teen-genetic-disease-enjoys-prom-assisted-suicide-article-1.2723198][b][color=white]Teen Enjoys Prom Before her Medically Assisted Suicide[/color][/b][/url]
Jerika Bolen, a 14 year old teenager, suffers from an incurable genetic condition, Spinal Muscular Atrophy Type 2. She has made the decision of ultimately ending her life, which the process will begin in August. The condition damages her muscles which leads to constant pains. Jerika has never actually walked, and she faces excruciating pains on a daily basis. Before the process begins, one of Jerika's dreams was to go to prom. Her friends and numerous people from her community made this dream a reality for her. Over a thousand people showed up to this event, and Jerika was the prom queen for the night.

[url=http://www.news4jax.com/news/national/2-dead-at-least-14-injured-in-florida-nightclub-shooting][b][color=white]Two Dead in Shooting at Florida Nightclub 'Teen Night'[/color][/b][/url]
At around 12:30 a.m. on July 25, a shooting occurred outside a Florida nightclub's teen party which ultimately left two people dead and at least 14 people injured. The Lee Memorial Hospital received people aging from as young as 12 to 27 years old with injuries. Club Blu released a statement on their Facebook page, "We tried to give the teens WHAT WE THOUGHT WAS A SAFE PLACE TO HAVE A GOOD TIME. Ages 12-17. There was armed security as well as full security, inside and out. As the club was closing and parents were picking their children up.....that's when all this took place. There was nothing more we could of done as you see it was not kids at the party that did this despicable act." The two victims that have been killed are identified as Shawn Achilles, age 14, and Ste'fan Strawder, age 18.

[url=http://www.eonline.com/news/782375/jennifer-aniston-gets-emotional-when-discussing-self-doubt-at-italy-s-giffoni-film-festival][b][color=white]Jennifer Aniston Gets Emotional When Discussing Self-Doubt[/color][/b][/url]
The popular actress attended the Giffoni Film Festival and was asked, "I’d like to know if you ever had a moment in which you get up a morning and you don’t know who you are." The question itself was very deep as self doubt can break so many people growing up in today's society. Jennifer answers with, "Yes, that moment has happened to me — there’s not enough fingers and toes in the room to count how many times that happened. We're all human beings at the end of the day, whether we're a waitress or a baker or a student or whatever we are, at the end of the day you kind of can hit walls and think I can't go any farther. Or this is too much. My heart can't take it or the pain is too great, or am I good enough? Will I survive?" She continues, "And you just have to sort of somehow miraculously overcome. You just go, ‘I can't, yes I can, yes you can.'" Jennifer's goal with this was to prove that humans are humans, regardless of your social or financial status. We all face obstacles in our lives, and she encourages everyone to remain persistent and push through the difficult times. After her answer, she also mentioned that you should talk to someone and always find something to inspire you. It is really nice to see this sort of transparency from such a popular individual.

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Comics/Wires.png[/img][/align]

[align=center]
[b][size=x-large]|1|[/size][/b][sp=]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/MHCS4on.png[/img][/sp]
